pageAbstract: In response to the recent claim of discrimination against some in the Tamil community in Auroville, we hosted a 2-day Cross-Cultural Dialogue.
In collaboration with Auroville Village Action Group and Nimisha Desai, founder of the NGO "Olakh" (Gujarat), we will present a documentary about Nimisha’s work with women’s justice.

pageTitle: Walk of Hope in Auroville & the Bioregion
pageAbstract: The Walk was led by Sri M, an eminent spiritual guide, educationist and social activist.
We want to explore and understand this question: Are we divided in Auroville, as local Tamil Aurovilians and non-local Aurovilians?
We hosted a 6-day Film Festival, in hopes to raise awareness about Restorative Justice and hopefully contribute to building a justice system that is in alignment with our Auroville values.

What can we do as a community to openly share past pain and to restore connection and trust? Community members, volunteers and guests, all were invited to join us in exploring different ways of healing relationships which have been developed in various parts of the world.
